---
_id: 8f1dcdc2-0654-491a-911a-289fa4c8d849
category: Vue.js
topic: Custom Directives
difficulty: Hard
options:
  - id: 1
    option: This custom directive works both on pageload and when an element is dynamically rendered by Vue. Meanwhile, autofocus atribute only works on pageload.
  - id: 2
    option: autofocus attribute works both on pageload and when an element is dynamically rendered by Vue. But the custom directive only works on pageload.
  - id: 3
    option: There is no difference; both behave the same way.
  - id: 4
    option: The custom directive can only be used on input elements, while autofocus can be used on any HTML element.
correctOptionId: 1
referenceLink: https://vuejs.org/guide/reusability/custom-directives.html#when-to-use
---

::question{:type="questionType"}
The code below is a custom directive that brings an element into focus. What advantage does it have over the built-in autofocus attribute in HTML?

<br />

```js
<script setup>
const vFocus = {
  mounted: (el) => el.focus()
}
</script>

<template>
  <input v-focus />
</template>
```

<br />

::playgroundLink{href="https://play.vuejs.org/#"}
::

::

::explanation{:type="explanationType"}

**Explanation: The custom directive works both on pageload and when an element is dynamically rendered by Vue. autofocus attribute only works on pageload.**

::
